p: Acute sinusitis is a common problem in this age group. Sinusitis has been known to precede a worsening of asthma, and episodes of acute sinusitis have often been the occasion for a course of antibiotics. The entity of viral rhinosinusitis, though, is far more common than previously believed. A viral RTI can produce a week or more of purulent discharge and radiographic abnormalities of the sinus cavities on CT scans ( 33). Most acute sinusitis is not predominantly initiated by bacteria nor, at least in the first week or so, antibiotic-responsive ( 34, 35). The mechanism by which acute viral sinusitis becomes linked with worsening asthma is generally through the association of both diseases with viral infection (Fig. 3).
